Manager, Talent Acquisition (Engineer Whisperer) Front-End, Full-Stack, & IOS & Android
San Francisco Bay Area (Remote from SF -- Main Location in Mt. View)

• Currently leading a team of 5 people (recruiters, lead generation, and sourcers)• In the past managed a team of up to 7 sourcers (engineering & functional)• Managed and mentored a contract team of 7 resulting in 5 of those being hired full-time• Engineering technical go-to for Intuit's entire Talent Acquisition Team• Coached recruiters new to various tech disciplines, bringing them up to speed in the most competitive    areas of web & mobile tech• Training expert/go-to for deep web, boolean strings, sourcing & recruiting strategy• I fill very difficult technical reqs w/ a specialization in: Front-end & Full-Stack Engineering, Big Data, Data Analytics, Web Analytics, Data Warehouse, Data Science, Backend Engineering, & Architects & Manager of all specializations• I partner w/ a small group of Intuit engineers to help create a company-wide front-end community, that includes live events, leading to greater front-end innovation across the company• Worked as a key partner to integrate many innovative strategies and tactics that brought hiring     managers closer to our target hiring communities• Extremely active in the Bay Area Meetup community• Expert in all internal & external recruiting tools (ATS, social, & others)
ClassWall brings a college student’s complicated school life together fostering kick a$$ collaboration between professors and students in and out of class.LinkedIn meets Slack, for college students

All things gaming engineering. A very niche and difficult space. Rolled a boulder uphill, w/ a company that had stale games, stale technology, and layoffs within the last 1.5 years. Key recruiter to deliver the best engineering talent in the business. Brought forth a number of innovative, ahead of their time tactics, that resulted in true results, w/ a kick-a$$ engineering team.
Helped the professional services department hire technical and business hybrids that significantly changed the landscape of the entire billing of the professional services team.
WOW! If memory serves me correctly, back in the day, I still, "Rocked it!"

recommendations: Dave Mendoza
Managing Director,  Talent Strategies & Innovations at the Talent Engine.io (30K Connections)
August 10, 2013, Dave worked with Chris in different groups

I have known of Chris Cox within similar Talent Acquisition industry circles over the past 6 years. Whereas geography has unfortunately limited the number of barista visits I've shared with him, his reputation precedes him within ear shot of the many who admire his expertise in best practices, in addition to his renown recruitment and sourcing capabilities. It is often and emphatic the types of commentary Chris earns on the pedestal he is placed and in all my discourse, both direct and in correspondence, I see the veracity of what is said and is possible of Chris. He is an outstanding and altruistic colleague. Hi is someone in our profession I never need question a kindness will be exchanged or an encouragement made on behalf of other's efforts. His executive leadership, his colleagues, and his friends are all invested in Chris for all these reasons; and in the same lofty regard I, too, have recognized. In all things Chris prevails. He has earned the highest respect and career expectations from those who know him. He is a recruiter's recruiter … and for that alone; along with all the other prevailing winds that speak to his future success, …. it should be said that nice guys do indeed finish first. When the next assignment and leadership elevation lift Chris to his next journey, it will be one people will universally celebrate - because he is …. a great guy and a great contributor to the type of industry we aspire to build together. I give him my highest recommendation because everyone agrees - what I see, and hear, and above all personally experienced make it all the more well deserved for someone as gifted as Chris Cox. I sincerely hope we shall work as peers someday soon

Chris Cox has a wealth of knowledge and I learned much from him in the six months I spent at LucasArts.  We were a tight knit group and being the new person there; he helped me grow into a challenging position as a Project Sourcer!  Chris is patient, professional, fun and approachable - all important traits for recruiters!  I thoroughly enjoyed working with Chris and would highly recommend him for any recruiting/sourcing position.  I heard from more than one person on our team that he is an amazing sourcer and I was able to witness that for myself.

summary: Because third person self-descriptions make you seem more important…Chris’s brings an entrepreneurial approach to everything he does. His passion for cutting edge technology, startups, and building things is pulling him deeper and deeper into web & mobile technology. Building his own side project: www.ClassWall.com; Chris has experience with the lean startup methodology, product management, Agile methodology/ticketing, working with offshore teams, and light front-end development. With hiring managers, he quickly instills confidence, builds trust, and lays out the opportunities and challenges of their particular market/s. He's currently focusing on Front-End, Full-Stack, & Mobile Engineering. He is also a recruiting expert in the areas of data science, big data, analytics (data, web, & product), backend engineering, native mobile (IOS & Android), data warehousing, and architecture/leadership roles across many different disciplines. He loves working on roles that include technologies like: Neo4j, MongoDB, Riak, Cassandra, (Hadoop – Cloudera & Hortonworks) Spark, Storm, Adobe Marketing Cloud/SiteCatalyst, Cloud/AWS/etc., R, SQL, SAS, Tableau, Python, data science algorithms, continuous integration (CI & CD), Java/J2EE, Scala, Node.js, JavaScript: React.js, Backbone.js, AngularJS, CSS3/HTML5, Bootstrap, LESS & Sass,  and IOS: Objective-C/Cocoa/Swift.
name: Chris Cox
title: Nerd Herder - Manager, Talent Acquisition (Engineering)
